H0.text: when did university stop being free in australia. 1975

H1.text: when did university stop being free in australia. 1992

H2.text: when did university stop being free in australia. 1985

H3.text: when did university stop being free in australia. 1989

A4.text: In 1973, the Whitlam Labor Government abolished university fees.

A5.text: By the mid-1980s, the method by which fees were re-introduced proved to be a system accepted by both Federal political parties and consequently still in place today.

A6.text: In 1974, the Whitlam Labor government abolished university fees to make tertiary education in Australia more accessible to working and middle class Australians.

A7.text: In 1989, the Hawke Labor government began gradually re-introducing fees for university study and setup the Higher Education Contributions Scheme (HECS).
